tags.description: This camp has lovely scenery and is close to a surf beach at Pukatea/Whites Bay. Go walking, fishing, swimming or kayaking from here.
tags.name: Whites Bay Campsite

tags.description: A scenic spot for boating, fishing and swimming.
tags.name: Moetapu Bay Campsite
FreshChoice
tags.opening_hours: Oct-Apr Mo-Su,PH 07:00-21:00; May-Sep Mo-Su,PH 07:00-19:30; Dec 25 off; Apr 25 13:00-21:00

tags.description: Camp next to the beach. Fish, surf at a nearby beach, or watch for Hector’s dolphins.
tags.name: Robin Hood Bay Campsite

tags.description: This Standard campsite is set in remnant podocarp forest.
tags.name: Onamalutu Campsite

tags.description: A large, flat, sheltered camping area that makes a great base for exploring Tennyson Inlet and the nearby area by boat, on foot or by mountain bike.
tags.name: Harvey Bay Campsite

tags.description: Picturesque setting and a great base for a range of activities, including boating, fishing, walking and mountain biking on the nearby Queen Charlotte Track.
tags.name: Kenepuru Head Campsite

tags.description: This flat campsite is in a sheltered bay and offers a good base for exploring the area by sea or land.
tags.name: Nikau Cove Campsite

tags.description: This is a scenic area with walking, sea kayaking, motor boating, kayaking, fishing and bird watching.
tags.name: Picnic Bay Campsite

tags.description: Scenic campsite suitable for kayaks and boating activities.
tags.name: Tawa Bay Campsite

tags.description: In striking surroundings, this campsite is used mostly by kayakers. Other activities include hunting, boating and walking.
tags.name: Waiona Bay Campsite

tags.description: This isolated campsite on the water's edge is a good base for water activities or fishing.
tags.name: Waimaru Campsite

tags.description: Located in a sheltered, scenic bay with opportunities for walking, biking and boating.
tags.name: Nydia Campsite

tags.description: Walk or mountain bike to this campsite from the Queen Charlotte Track in the Marlborough Sounds. There is no drive in access.
tags.name: Black Rock Campsite

tags.description: A sheltered east-facing bay with walking, boating, mountain biking and fishing close by.
tags.name: Schoolhouse Bay Campsite

tags.description: A remote campsite with hunting and water-based activities near by.
tags.name: Cannibal Cove Campsite

tags.description: Camp beside a sandy beach (rare in the Sounds) that is sheltered from the norwesterly wind. Enjoy short walks, picnicking and water-based activities.
tags.name: Ferndale

tags.description: Camp beside the beach and go fishing, explore and enjoy the peace only 15-minute drive away from the Picton ferry.
tags.name: Whatamango Bay Campsite

tags.description: A sheltered east-facing bay with a short walk, boating, water skiing and fishing opportunities close by.
tags.name: Kumutoto Bay Campsite

tags.description: Popular with sea kayakers, with a small, rocky beach
tags.name: Putanui Point Campsite

tags.description: This scenic campsite is a great base for water-based activities and picnicking.
tags.name: Pipi Beach Campsite

tags.description: Enjoy short walks and water-based activities at this campsite, which is sheltered from the prevailing northwest winds.
tags.name: Jacobs Bay Campsite

tags.description: This is a basic campsite in the Sounds area. Campsite for boaties and sea kayakers in a peaceful setting.
tags.name: Kauauroa Bay Campsite

tags.description: A popular site with a long sandy beach for boating, fishing and picnicking.
tags.name: Ratimera Bay Campsite

tags.description: An isolated campsite with water-based activities for those who want to get away from it all.
tags.name: Ngaruru Bay Campsite

tags.description: North-facing seafront site on a picturesque, pest free island. Walk the track to the historic WWII gun emplacements, experience the all day 'dawn chorus' and enjoy the stunning views.
tags.name: Blumine Island/oruawairua Campsite

tags.description: A tranquil setting beside the sea, with a range of activities nearby including walking and mountain biking on the Queen Charlotte Track.
tags.name: Aussie Bay Campsite

tags.description: A north-facing serviced family campsite beside a sheltered bay, popular for swimming, boating and fishing. Short walk and glow-worm grotto on site.
tags.name: Momorangi Campsite

tags.description: This campsite offers a good base for exploring Pelorus Sound by boat and walking or mountain biking nearby tracks.
tags.name: Elaine Bay Campsite

tags.description: Camp next to the beach. Fish, walk, picnic, or simply sit and enjoy the roar of the waves.
tags.name: Rarangi Campsite

tags.description: North-facing site that is a great base for water-based activities in the outer Queen Charlotte Sound.
tags.name: Wharehunga Bay Campsite

tags.description: Explore Kenepuru Sound by boat, walk or mountain bike the nearby Queen Charlotte Track or relax by the water surrounded by native bush.
tags.name: Cowshed Bay Campsite

tags.description: In a sheltered bay with fishing, boating, walking, mountain biking, plus a lodge with a bar, small shop and restaurant nearby. Boat and walk-in access only.
tags.name: Camp Bay Campsite

tags.description: Walk or mountain bike in to this backcountry campsite in the Marlborough Sounds. Access is from the Queen Charlotte Track. There is no drive in access.
tags.name: Bay Of Many Coves Campsite

tags.description: Large accessible site with boating activities close by. Choose a waterfront site or a bush clearing to camp in. Boat and walk-in access only.
tags.name: Davies Bay Campsite
